feed.title: NewsTracker: boko haram
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Boko Haram leaves grave of throat-slit corpses near Damasak
entry.summary: Soldiers from Niger and Chad who liberated the Nigerian town of Damasak from Boko Haram militants have discovered the bodies of at least 70 people, many with their throats slit, scattered under a bridge, a Reuters witness said.

entry.title: Retreating Boko Haram leaves mass of throat-slit corpses near Nigerian town
entry.summary: "People were in town when they (Boko Haram) attacked, they fired at us, we ran away to the bushes but they continued to fire and chased some people to kill them," said Damasak resident Mbodou Moussa.

entry.title: 100 bodies in Nigeria 'mass grave' in town taken from Boko Haram
entry.summary: Soldiers discovered the bodies -- some decapitated -- under a bridge just outside Damasak, which was retaken from Boko Haram on March 9 by troops from Chad and Niger.

entry.title: Retreating Boko Haram leaves mass of throat-slit corpses near Nigerian town
entry.summary: On Thursday, however, two security sources told Reuters that Boko Haram had killed at least 10 people in the town of Gamburu, on the border with Cameroon, demonstrating it can still attack civilians despite being forced into retreat.

entry.title: Mass Grave of Boko Haram Victims Found
Boko Haram 'slaughter wives' in Nigeria
entry.summary:
Maiduguri: Dozens of Nigerian women who were forced to marry Boko Haram fighters have reportedly been slaughtered by their "husbands" before a battle with troops in the northeast town of Bama.

According to Ms Bakura's account, which was supported by others, Boko Haram fighters received word of a military assault on Bama, formerly an Islamist stronghold in Borno state.

Boko Haram forcibly married scores of women in Bama after seizing it in September.

entry.title: Boko Haram forces attack Nigeria?s Gamboru, slaughter forced wives in Bama amid retreat
entry.summary: The Gamboru attack came after reports of another atrocity blamed on Boko Haram in Bama.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigeria's Gamboru, women slaughtered in Bama
entry.summary: Residents of Fotokol, a town in Cameroon but effectively attached to Gamboru, said the rebel onslaught began on Wednesday and there were indications that Boko Haram intended to occupy Gamboru again.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigeria town of Gamboru, kills 11: witnesses
entry.summary: "Boko Haram gunmen returned on motorcycles to Gamboru yesterday... and shot dead eight people," said Mudi Dankaka in an account supported by others, adding that three more people were killed Thursday morning.

entry.title: Proposed UN resolution would endorse military action by an African force against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
The draft resolution expresses "deep concern" that Boko Haram recently pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group.

It declares that terrorist acts by Boko Haram and others constitute "one of the most serious threats to international peace and security."

It "demands that Boko Haram immediately and unequivocally cease all hostilities and all abuses of human rights and violations of international humanitarian law and disarm."

entry.title: UN seeks to endorse military action against Boko Haram
Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls
entry.summary:
A spate of recent suicide bombings carried out by young women and girls has raised fears that Boko Haram is using kidnap victims to increase its deadly toll.

In early February, Nigeria's air force began bombarding the Sambisa Forest, a stronghold of Boko Haram where the Chibok girls first were taken.

entry.title: Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls
entry.summary:
"We are optimistic that ... we will get further details on them" as Boko Haram's area of influence shrinks, Minimah said in Abuja, Nigeria's capital.

He said Boko Haram now holds only three of 27 local government areas in Borno, the third northeastern state under a military state of emergency and the birthplace of Boko Haram.

More than 1.5 million people driven from their homes by Boko Haram's nearly 6-year-old Islamic uprising.

entry.title: Nigeria's military: No news of 219 kidnapped Chibok girls as jets bomb Boko Haram stronghold
entry.summary:
The admission of lack of progress on the missing schoolgirls comes as the Nigerian military, bolstered by forces from neighboring countries, is regaining towns and cities held by Boko Haram in northeastern Nigeria.

He said he is in hiding because he has become a wanted man by Boko Haram because of his role as a spokesman for parents of the Chibok girls.

entry.title: Nigeria says has pushed Boko Haram out of all but three areas
entry.summary: The elections were postponed in February until March 28, with the military citing Boko Haram as warranting the delay.

entry.title: Nigeria says it has pushed Boko Haram out of all but 3 areas
entry.summary:
At the start of this year, Boko Haram controlled around 20 local government areas, a territory the size of Belgium, in its bloody six-year-old campaign to carve out an Islamic state in religiously mixed Nigeria.

Boko Haram's worsening atrocities against civilians hit international headlines in April last year, when the militants kidnapped more than 200 schoolgirls from the village of Chibok, triggering a search for them that has been fruitless thus far.

entry.title: Nigeria: Final onslaught launched against Boko Haram
entry.summary: "As for the other three areas [Abadam, Gwoza and Askira], help is coming," said Omeri, who announced last week that 36 towns had been recaptured from Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram kills one in north Cameroon attack: army
entry.summary: The Nigerian army said on Tuesday it had repelled Boko Haram from all but three local government districts in the northeast, claiming victory for its offensive against the Islamist insurgents less than two weeks before a presidential election.

entry.title: Nigeria begins 'final onslaught' against Boko Haram: govt
entry.summary:
The military announced that Adawama was "cleared" last Friday and that Yobe was retaken on Monday from Boko Haram, who have pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group in Syria and Iraq.

Jonathan is facing a stiff challenge from the main opposition candidate Muhammadu Buhari, a former miliary ruler who has attacked the president's record on tackling Boko Haram.

entry.title: Foreigners train Nigerian troops as "final onslaught" hits Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Africa's most populous nation and top energy producer has been plagued by the Boko Haram insurgency since 2009, when insurgents intensified efforts to establish an Islamic caliphate in the northeastern Borno state.

However, this year Nigeria and its neighbors have launched a series of offensives to recapture territory, turning the tide against Boko Haram in the run-up to the hotly contested presidential poll.

entry.title: Nigerian, Cameroon troops oust Boko Haram from town, village
entry.summary: The Cameroonians acted after Ndaba residents reported that Boko Haram militants were massing in the hills around the village, 20 kilometers (12 miles) from the border with Cameroon, Kodji said.

entry.title: Boko Haram militants attack village in Chad, killing one
entry.summary:
"Boko Haram elements this morning attacked the village of Djargagoroum, between Ngouboua and Kaiga," said a resident of the targeted village who asked not to be named.

Boko Haram raided nearby Ngouboua, on the shores of Lake Chad, last month in the group's first known lethal attack on Chadian soil.

entry.title: Children rescued from Boko Haram so traumatised they have forgotten their names
entry.summary:
Nairobi, Kenya: After years in a Boko Haram camp, the children had forgotten their native language.

They had been rescued by the country's military in November from a squalid Boko Haram encampment near the border with Nigeria.

"Even if kinetic operations were to end soon and Boko Haram was taken off the battlefield, it would take years to really address consequences in humanitarian terms."

In April 2014, Boko Haram grabbed the world's attention when fighters abducted 200 schoolgirls in northern Nigeria.

entry.title: France increases its efforts to back African forces fighting Boko Haram
entry.summary:
France supports the offensive led by Chad in cooperation with Cameroon, Niger and Nigeria - Boko Haram's base.

The operation to fight Boko Haram is "flexible," which means that some troops can be redeployed from one country to another, one of the officials said without giving more details.

France's defense minister said this week that the country would "slightly" increase its number of troops in the Sahel region by the end of the year, but does not intend to take active part in the fighting against Boko Haram.

entry.title: Islamic State group accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: "The prompt - one might even say 'fast-tracked' - acceptance by the so-called Islamic State of Boko Haram's pledge of allegiance" underscores that both needed the propaganda boost from the affiliation, Pham added.

entry.title: Islamic State group accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: BEIRUT (AP) - Islamic State militants have accepted a pledge of allegiance by the Nigerian-grown Boko Haram extremist group, according to a spokesman for the Islamic State movement.

entry.title: Islamic State says it has accepted Boko Haram?s pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: Members of the U.N. Security Council proposed Thursday that the international community supply money, equipment, troops and intelligence to a five-nation African force fighting Boko Haram.

entry.title: ISIS accepts Boko Haram pledge, says would-be recruits can go to Nigeria
entry.summary: Peter Pham, director of the Africa Center at the Atlantic Council, a think tank in Washington, noted the Islamic State group's quick acceptance of Boko Haram's allegiance and said that the bond highlights a new risk.

entry.title: ISIS claims stronghold in West Africa following Boko Haram's allegiance
entry.summary: Today, the Islamic State group's media arm Al-Furqan, in an audio recording by spokesman Abu Mohammed al-Adnani, said that Boko Haram's pledge of allegiance has been accepted, claiming the caliphate has now expanded to West Africa.

entry.title: Islamic State accepts Boko Haram allegiance
entry.summary: "Our caliph, God save him, has accepted the pledge of loyalty of our brothers of Boko Haram so we congratulate Muslims and our jihadi brothers in West Africa," said IS spokesman Abu Mohammad al-Adnani.

entry.title: Chad, Niger troops push Boko Haram out of two Nigerian towns
entry.summary: Troops from Chad and Niger have freed two towns in northern Nigeria previously held by Boko Haram, the first gains made in a joint offensive launched at the weekend, military sources said on Monday.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: If the Islamic State does embrace Boko Haram, it is uncertain what level of coordination there will be between the terrorist outfits thousands of miles apart.

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
If confirmed, the pledge would make the group, Boko Haram, which is believed to have as many as 6,000 fighters, the largest extremist group to date to agree to fight under the Islamic State banner, analysts said.

Terrorism experts say that the pledge, or "bayat", is a spiritually binding oath, and it indicates that Boko Haram's leader agrees to be under the authority of the Islamic State group.

If confirmed, the agreement with Boko Haram would mirror the steps taken by Islamic State affiliates in Libya, Algeria, Egypt, Afghanistan and beyond.

"But the biggest issue with Boko Haram is that it's not a homogeneous group and it behaves as different factions. So it's too early to tell for sure if Boko Haram will fall directly under ISIS command, and to what extent they will act as an ISIS proxy."

entry.title: Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: "It's quite clear that since at least mid-January, the Islamic State has had some level of connection with Boko Haram," said Aaron Zelin, a fellow at the Washington Institute who tracks propaganda by Islamic extremists.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram, weakened by multinational attacks, pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria - Nigeria's home-grown Boko Haram group, newly weakened by a multinational force that has dislodged it from a score of northeastern towns, reportedly pledged formal allegiance to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
The Boko Haram pledge to IS comes as the Nigerian militants reportedly are massing in the northeastern town of Gwoza, considered their headquarters, for a showdown with the Chadian-led multinational force.

The Twitter account, increasingly slick and more frequent video messages from Boko Haram, and a new media arm all are considered signs that the group is being helped by IS propagandists.

Boko Haram in August followed the lead of IS in declaring an Islamic caliphate in northeast Nigeria that grew to cover an area the size of Belgium.

entry.title: Now ISIS takes a terrifying stranglehold on Nigeria after Boko Haram releases audio recording pledging allegiance to the terror group?
entry.summary:
Rita Katz, from terrorism monitor SITE Intelligence Group, said: 'Boko Haram is now being elevated from a local jihadi group to an important arm of the Islamic State.

With Boko Haram's wide network in North Africa, the Islamic State's projection of creating an Islamic Caliphate is gaining headway.

entry.title: Boko Haram pledges allegiance to ISIS
entry.summary: Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau makes the oath in Arabic in a tweeted message saying: "We announce our allegiance to the Caliph of the Muslims."

entry.title: Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State: monitoring group
entry.summary: On Saturday, four bomb blasts killed at least 50 people in the northeastern Nigerian city of Maiduguri in the worst attacks there since Boko Haram militants tried to seize the town in two major assaults earlier this year.

entry.title: Boko Haram declares allegiance to Isis
entry.summary: The pledge came in an Arabic audio message with English subtitles alleged to have come from Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau and posted Saturday on Twitter, according to the SITE Intelligence monitoring service.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram bombings kill more than 10 in northeast Nigeria
entry.summary: Though there was no way to independently verify the message, it comes weeks after Boko Haram's new Twitter account broadcast that the group's Shura council was considering whether to swear formal allegiance to IS.

entry.title: Lakeside communities in Chad live in fear of Boko Haram after new wave of attacks
entry.summary:
"The Boko Haram are against Islam."

Boko Haram militants torched their hiding spot and it wasn't long before one of the girls burned to death beside him.

Ndingou was afraid of dying or being kidnapped by Boko Haram.

More than 200 Boko Haram militants ultimately were repelled by Chadian forces there, said local police commissioner Idriss Ibrahim.

While Boko Haram's leaders says it is attacking Chad and other neighboring countries because they support a regional military effort against the group, local authorities believe the group is motivated by greed.

As northeastern Nigeria - where Boko Haram has traditionally been based - becomes increasingly isolated, the fighters are pillaging wherever they go.

entry.title: Boko Haram readies for battle in northeast Nigeria, residents say
entry.summary:
"She told me that Boko Haram terrorists asked them to leave suddenly, that they were preparing grounds for a major battle," Adama told The Associated Press.

"She said while being helped by other women to leave through Madagali, they saw many Boko Haram terrorists in trucks and some on bikes moving toward Gwoza."

An intelligence officer said security forces are moving slowly for fear of harming civilians, and especially since Boko Haram is surrounding Gwoza with land mines.

Boko Haram in August declared an Islamic caliphate across a swath of northeast Nigeria where it held sway.

entry.title: Boko Haram killing men, tribes linked to Chad, witnesses say
entry.summary: "They gathered the people in the market, and then separated the Kanuris from the Shuwa Arabs; then they informed the Shuwa Arabs that it was your tribesmen of Chad that are tormenting (Boko Haram)," he said.

entry.title: Boko Haram refugees risk lives to cross lake to Chad camps
entry.summary: Officials say that several thousand had arrived in Chad by the end of 2015 as Boko Haram intensified its attacks in the area.

entry.title: Boko Haram refugees risk lives to cross lake to Chad camps
entry.summary: "If I had stayed there they would have killed me too," she said softly inside a tent at a refugee camp now home to more than 6,000 Nigerians who have fled Boko Haram's violence.

entry.title: Boko Haram Refugees Risk Lives to Cross Lake to Chad Camps
Refugees flee Boko Haram violence in Nigeria by boat as jihadist group steps up violence
entry.summary: It was one of the worst massacres ever carried out by Boko Haram during its five-year insurgency.

entry.title: Surrender or face death: Chad president to Boko Haram leader
Chad president tells Boko Haram leader to surrender or face death
entry.summary:
Chad's army has waged a series of battles against Boko Haram as part of a cross-border military campaign and has re-taken territory the militant group held in northeastern Nigeria.

It first deployed to help Cameroon fend off Boko Haram and is now pressing southwest into Nigerian territory after capturing the border town of Gambaru last month.

entry.title: Chad president tells Boko Haram leader to surrender or face death
entry.summary:
"He was in Dikwa two days ago. He managed to get away but we know where he is. It's in his interests to surrender," Deby said, referring to a town in northeastern Nigeria held by Boko Haram that fell to Chad's army earlier this week.

On Wednesday, a bomb planted and remotely detonated by Boko Haram militants near the southeastern Niger town of Diffa killed two soldiers and wounded a third, Niger military sources said.

entry.title: Chad: Boko Haram massacres civilians in Nigeria town
entry.summary: Separately, southwest of Dikwa, Nigerian troops Monday repelled an attack by Boko Haram on Konduga, killing more than 70 insurgents, according to a Nigerian corporal who helped defend the town.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: The group previously had links to al Qaeda and though Boko Haram and IS have acknowledged each other, the Nigerian militants have not officially pledged allegiance to IS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary:
Abuja: Nigeria's Islamist sect Boko Haram released a video purporting to show it beheading two men, its first online posting using advanced graphics and editing techniques reminiscent of footage from Islamic State.

Nigerian troops pose with a flag of Boko Haram after dismantling terrorists from their camp along Djimitillo Damaturu Road, Yobe State in northeastern Nigeria, following fierce fighting there.

A burnt truck is seen in front of a building that Boko Haram insurgents used as their base before being driven out by the Chadian military in the northeast Nigerian town of Dikwa.

The Boko Haram film's use of graphics, the footage of black-clad militants with a black flag, and the editing to show only the aftermath of the beheading, were particularly reminiscent of footage from Islamic state, which has seized large parts of Iraq and Syria and killed several hostages.

entry.title: Hundreds killed as Chad forces seize northeast Nigerian town
entry.summary:
A Nigerian soldier said Nigerian troops killed 70 Boko Haram fighters to repel an attack Monday on Konduga town.

Konduga has been attacked many times because it is 35 kilometers (25 miles) from Maiduguri, the biggest northeastern city and the birthplace of Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram beheading video suggests group is 'incorporating itself into Islamic State' with 'Isis-like' production techniques
entry.summary: Nigeria's President Goodluck Jonathan has said Boko Haram is allied to both al-Qaeda and Isis, though that has not been confirmed by the group itself.

entry.title: Boko Haram beheadings video echoes Isis techniques
entry.summary: Past Boko Haram films have been cruder, often featuring a man identified as the leader Abubakar Shekau discussing local gripes instead of preaching global jihad.

entry.title: Nigeria?s Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Boko Haram has killed thousands and kidnapped hundreds in its bid to carve out an Islamist state in its homeland, and in recent months has increased cross-border raids into Cameroon, Chad and Niger.

entry.title: Nigeria stalls Chad, aims to beat Boko Haram before election
entry.summary:
But with presidential elections this month, Nigeria is keen to press ahead with its own military campaign against Boko Haram, aiming to push it out of major towns before the March 28 ballot.

Officials from Chad, Niger and Cameroon say lack of cooperation from Nigeria has for months hampered efforts to put together a regional taskforce against Boko Haram.

Boko Haram was long regarded by neighboring countries as an internal Nigerian problem, but attacks in Cameroon and Niger last year prompted the regional response.

Another senior Cameroon military figure said they were attempting to choke off Boko Haram's revenues, including the trade in fuel with Cameroon, Chad and Niger.

entry.title: Chadian troops seize Nigerian town of Dikwa from Boko Haram
entry.summary: He added that many Boko Haram fighters had also been killed in the clashes on Monday in northeastern Nigeria, the Islamist group's stronghold.

entry.title: New Boko Haram Video Appears To Show Two Captives Beheaded
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has said in social media messages last month that it is considering swearing allegiance to IS.

Boko Haram previously published only one beheading, of a Nigerian fighter pilot whose plane went missing in September.

Boko Haram began emulating the Islamic State group last August, declaring it had established an Islamic caliphate in territory it controls in northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram video shows 2 beheaded men accused of spying
entry.summary: The SITE intelligence group said the video called "Harvest of Spies" was posted Monday on Twitter by Boko Haram's new media arm.

entry.title: Boko Haram kill villagers after fleeing offensive
entry.summary: For most of the past year, Boko Haram has been gaining strength, seizing territory the size of Belgium and kidnapping hundreds of people, mostly women and children.

entry.title: In camps, Nigerian refugees fear for family left to Boko Haram
entry.summary: Then, on Oct. 1, the area was again attacked by Boko Haram fighters.

entry.title: Nigerian planes bomb Boko Haram camps, military says
entry.summary:
"The death of a large number of terrorists has been recorded while many others are also scampering all over the forest," defence spokesman Major-General Chris Olukolade said on Thursday, later adding that an attack was under way on parts of Gwoza, the town where Boko Haram first declared an Islamic state last year.

Sambisa gained notoriety last year when more than 200 girls kidnapped by Boko Haram from a secondary school in nearby Chibok were taken there.

entry.title: Nigerian army says 300 Boko Haram militants killed
entry.summary: The military says it's killed 300 Boko Haram fighters in an operation to recapture 11 towns and villages.

entry.title: US launches Africa military exercises amid Boko Haram threat
entry.summary:
While the upcoming multinational force against Boko Haram is not a specific focus of Flintlock, the training is aimed at broader themes that will apply to that mission.

Thiebes said the training is going ahead despite a recent series of Boko Haram attacks on Niger and Cameroon.

entry.title: US launches Africa military exercises amid Boko Haram threat
entry.summary: Now the most imminent danger to regional security is Boko Haram, which killed at least 10,000 people in Nigeria last year and is now staging cross-border attacks in Cameroon, Niger and Chad.

entry.title: Nigeria claims to have killed 300 Boko Haram militants in recapture of 11 towns
Boko Haram fighters blamed for Cameroon military base attack
entry.summary:
The 10 member states announced that they had contributed more than 50 percent of the $100 million needed to fight Boko Haram.

They also called on Nigeria to cooperate by allowing the multinational joint task force to attack Boko Haram in Nigeria.

entry.title: Central Africa leaders plan Boko Haram offensive
entry.summary:
Nigeria-based Boko Haram has widened its attacks into neighbouring nations, notably Cameroon and Chad, in a conflict estimated to have claimed 13,000 lives since 2009.

The detentions came as police in Niger said they had arrested more than 160 people suspected of having links to Boko Haram in the country's Diffa region, a border area with Nigeria which was attacked by the group this month.

entry.title: Boko Haram fighters blamed for Cameroon military base attack
Boko Haram issues new threat against Niger, Chad
entry.summary: On Monday, leaders in Central Africa said that 10 member states had agreed to contribute most of the $100 million needed to combat Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram insurgents attack Cameroon army base, several wounded
entry.summary: Earlier this month, Boko Haram fighters killed more than 100 people in the northern Cameroon town of Fotokol, including residents inside their homes and a mosque, a local political leader said.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigerian city
entry.summary:
The Boko Haram fighters left in a convoy of vehicles carrying dozens of corpses, according to residents.

Boko Haram's Islamic extremist insurgency killed 10,000 people last year compared to 2,000 in the four previous years, according to the US Council on Foreign Relations.

entry.title: Nigerian military repels Boko Haram attack on northeast town
entry.summary:
BAUCHI, Nigeria (AP) - Nigeria's military Saturday repelled an attack on a northeastern town by Boko Haram Islamic extremists who, as they retreated, warned residents not to participate in the country's elections in March.

The Associated Press obtained a copy of the message in which Boko Haram warned that its fighters will attack all polling stations in the March 28 elections.

entry.title: Nigerian military repels Boko Haram attack in northeast town
entry.summary: The United Nations special representative for West Africa said Friday that Nigeria's military needs to show "greater resolve" in the widening fight against Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Chad village as revolt spreads
entry.summary: Chad's army, one of the best in the region, has joined a regional offensive against Boko Haram and says it has killed hundreds of fighters in the past fortnight.

entry.title: Nigerian military repels Boko Haram attack on northeast town
Boko Haram Fight Intensifies In West Africa
entry.summary: Abubakar Shekau is the leader of Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram takes fight into Chad
entry.summary: Two Boko Haram fighters were also killed and five injured, N'Djamena said.

entry.title: Boko Haram Launches First Attack on Chadian Village
entry.summary: Boko Haram's insurgency has forced some 157,000 people to seek refuge in Niger, while 40,000 others have gone to Cameroon and 17,000 are in Chad, the U.N. said.

entry.title: Boko Haram Launches First Attack on Chadian Village
entry.summary: Ngouboua is already home to nearly 3,300 refugees who had fled Boko Haram-related violence back home in Nigeria, according to the United Nations.

entry.title: Boko Haram launches first attack on Chadian village
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has expanded its attacks against neighboring countries over the past week following threats to punish any nations contributing to the fight against the terror group.

Chad, Niger, Cameroon and Benin all have pledged to send military support though Chadian soldiers are already fighting Boko Haram militants inside Cameroon and Nigeria.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram launches first attack in Chad
entry.summary:
Dozens of Boko Haram fighters arrived in the early hours of the morning on motorized canoes at the fishing village on the shores of Lake Chad, setting houses ablaze and attacking a police station.

Nigeria has postponed for six weeks a presidential election that had been due on Saturday, citing the security threat from Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks village in Chad
entry.summary: The multinational force to fight Boko Haram is expected to be formally launched in coming weeks.
